page.title: 04The Church and the Rector
page.content: The present Rector has been in Cromhall for two years. He comes from Wales, and has already had twelve homes. His job is to care for all the people in the parish. He looks after the parishes of Cromhall, Tortworth and Tytherington. He prays every day for his parishioners, each of whom he names. He conducts services, visits the sick and housebound, marries, buries and baptizes people. Generally he is the agent of God in Cromhall. His working day begins at 7am and often continues until 10.30pm. He regrets that the people of Cromhall are not very religious. Out of a population of about eight hundred, the average attendance at St Andrews Church is between sixty and seventy.He feels people don't make enough time for God. He became a Rector because God wanted him to.
